questions.question: Which of the following best describes the traditional Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) as presented in Chapter 3?
options: Two discrete phases: development and maintenance
Three continuous phases: design, coding, testing
Four overlapping phases: requirements, design, build, test
One phase that includes all activities
questions.answer: Two discrete phases: development and maintenance

questions.question: What proportion of a product’s life‑span is typically spent on maintenance?
Which statement best captures a unique characteristic of software maintenance?
options: Maintenance is performed on an operational system, so changes must respect existing constraints
Maintenance is typically longer than development cycles
Test data for maintenance is always created from scratch
Maintenance does not require regression testing
questions.answer: Maintenance is performed on an operational system, so changes must respect existing constraints

questions.question: In Basili’s ‘Quick Fix Model’ what happens first?
options: Source code is modified to fix the problem
A full design review occurs first
questions.answer: Source code is modified to fix the problem

questions.question: The ‘Iterative Enhancement Model’ starts by revising which type of artifact?
Which of the following is NOT an activity in the ‘Full Reuse Model’?
options: Identify components that are candidates for reuse
Modify components to support new requirements
Integrate modified components into a new system
Create a brand‑new design from scratch
questions.answer: Create a brand‑new design from scratch

questions.question: According to the staged model of CSS, what is the first stage called?
In the staged model for FLOSS systems, which transition does NOT appear in the diagram?
What is the primary purpose of the Change Mini‑Cycle model?
options: To describe how a change may introduce new requirements or alter existing ones
To provide a detailed test plan for regression testing
To define the phases of a software release cycle
questions.answer: To describe how a change may introduce new requirements or alter existing ones

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the seven phases in IEEE/EIA 1219?
In IEEE/EIA 1219, which phase follows ‘System Test’?
What activity is performed during the Implementation phase of IEEE/EIA 1219?
options: Writing new code and performing unit testing
Creating a test suite for the new design
questions.answer: Writing new code and performing unit testing

questions.question: ISO/IEC 14764 describes maintenance as?
options: An iterative process for managing and executing activities
A set of static documentation tasks
A process that only handles releases
questions.answer: An iterative process for managing and executing activities

questions.question: Which activity is NOT part of ISO/IEC 14764’s maintenance process?
Software Configuration Management (SCM) is primarily concerned with controlling what?
options: All product items and their changes over time
questions.answer: All product items and their changes over time

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of effective SCM?
options: Higher quality software with less maintenance effort
Increased productivity due to better control
More frequent releases regardless of change size
questions.answer: More frequent releases regardless of change size

questions.question: SCM’s spectrum of functionality includes which category?
The change request (CR) workflow is primarily designed to:
options: Uniquely identify, describe and track each change
Track only the defects discovered during maintenance
questions.answer: Uniquely identify, describe and track each change

questions.question: Which state is NOT part of the CR life‑cycle diagram?
In a change request, what does 'CR' stand for?
Which activity in ISO/IEC 14764 is responsible for ‘migration’?
